**Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis**  
• **Frame 1** – The fire truck is in the leftmost through‐traffic lane (the far‐left signal head is showing a red left‐turn arrow, while the circular green to the right is lit). The truck is oriented straight, without a turn signal on or wheels angled.  
• **Frame 2** – The fire truck remains in the same lane, continuing forward. No sign of merging right, and there is no additional left lane into which it might move.  
• **Frame 3** – Still no movement toward any lane boundary. The truck stays lined up to go straight; the left‐turn arrow remains red.  
• **Frame 4** – The light remains green for through traffic. The fire truck is not slowing, signaling, or drifting.  
• **Frame 5** – The truck is progressing straight with no lateral movement or brake‐light indication, and the left‐turn arrow is still red.  

**Contextual Reasoning**  
Although it occupies the leftmost lane, that lane is for going straight or turning left. The dedicated left‐turn arrow is red, so left‐turn traffic is stopped. The fire truck shows no sign of turning or merging right; it is simply proceeding through the intersection under the green light.

**Match to Answer Choices**  
• **A. Stay in lane** – Matches the consistent path of the fire truck (no lane changes, no turn).  
• **B. Lane change to the left** – Impossible here, as the truck is already against the left edge of through traffic.  
• **C. Lane change to the right** – No movement or signal to that effect.  
• **D. Stop** – The truck is clearly moving forward on a green light, so no stop is expected.
